concise_definition: adj. 瞎的, 盲目的; n. 窗帘, 遮光板; v. 使失明, 使盲目

definitions.explanation_en: Unable to see due to physical impairment or loss of vision; lacking the ability to perceive visual information.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因生理损伤或视力丧失而无法看见；缺乏感知视觉信息的能力。
definitions.example_en: She has been blind since birth.

definitions.explanation_en: Not able to perceive or recognize something clearly, often due to prejudice, emotion, or lack of awareness; acting without rational judgment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 因偏见、情绪或缺乏意识而无法清晰认知某事物；行为缺乏理性判断。
definitions.example_en: His loyalty to the team made him blind to their flaws.
definitions.example_cn: 他对球队的忠诚使他忽视了他们的缺点。

definitions.explanation_en: A covering, typically made of fabric or slats, installed over a window to block light or provide privacy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 安装在窗户上用于遮挡光线或保护隐私的覆盖物，通常由布料或百叶板制成。
definitions.example_en: She pulled the blind shut to block out the morning sun.
definitions.example_cn: 她拉上窗帘以挡住早晨的阳光。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause someone to lose their sight, either physically or metaphorically, by overwhelming them with light, emotion, or misinformation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 使某人失去视力，无论是通过强烈的光线、情绪冲击，还是通过误导信息使其失去判断力。
definitions.example_en: The bright headlights blinded the driver for several seconds.
definitions.example_cn: 刺眼的车灯使司机几秒钟内看不见路。

comparison.analysis: “Sightless”（无视力的）是“blind”的同义词，但更正式、更中性，仅指生理上的视觉缺失，不包含“盲目”或“非理性”的隐喻含义。而 “blind” 既可用于生理描述，也可用于比喻语境，语义范围更广。
“Ignorant”（无知的）指缺乏知识或信息，但不必然意味着拒绝或无法认知；而 “blind” 在比喻用法中强调主动或被动的“视而不见”，常带有情感偏见或刻意回避的意味，语义更强烈。
“Curtain”（窗帘）是“blind”的近义词，但更泛指悬挂式布帘，常用于装饰或遮挡，不一定具备遮光功能；而 “blind” 特指可调节的、用于控制光线和隐私的窗饰，结构更具体（如百叶窗、卷帘）。
